it.unisa.diem.softwareengineering.assignment2021

Class VariablesHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • it.unisa.diem.softwareengineering.assignment2021.VariablesHandler

  • public class VariablesHandler
extends java.util.Observable
    A handler for the Variables class, which manages the current runtime variables and the old states of the variables when the save and restore commands are called, by keeping them in a stack. It extends Observable, so it can be observed by any class interested in keeping up to date with the state of the variables and their values.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VariablesHandler()
      Initializes the variables handler, starting the stack of states and the current variables state.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getVariables()
      returns the value of every variable from the current variables set and the most recent saved state of the variables, in a format like "variable:currentValue:oldValue".
      ComplexNumber load(java.lang.Character variable)
      Loads a variable's value.
      void reset()
      Clears the value of every current variable, by setting them to null, then notifies the observers.
      void restore()
      restores the most recent state of the variables by popping it from the variables stack, then notifies the observers.
      void save()
      Saves the current state of the variables and pushes it to the variables stack, then notifies observers.
      void store(java.lang.Character variable, ComplexNumber value)
      Stores a complex number into a variable, then notifies the observers.
      void subFromVariable(char variable, ComplexNumber cNumber)
      Subtracts a complex number from a variable's value, then notifies the observers.
      void sumToVariable(char variable, ComplexNumber cNumber)
      Sums a complex number to a variable's value, then notifies the observers.

        addObserver, clearChanged, countObservers, deleteObserver, deleteObservers, hasChanged, notifyObservers, notifyObservers, setChanged

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves the current state of the variables and pushes it to the variables stack, then notifies observers.

      • restore

        public void restore()
             throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        restores the most recent state of the variables by popping it from the variables stack, then notifies the observers.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - when there are no states saved in the variables stack.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Clears the value of every current variable, by setting them to null, then notifies the observers.

      • getVariables

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getVariables()
        returns the value of every variable from the current variables set and the most recent saved state of the variables, in a format like "variable:currentValue:oldValue".
        Returns:
        said iterator.

      • load

        public ComplexNumber load(java.lang.Character variable)
                   throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Loads a variable's value.
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable's name.
        Returns:
        the complex number stored into the variable.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - when the variable has no value yet.

      • store

        public void store(java.lang.Character variable,
                  ComplexNumber value)
        Stores a complex number into a variable, then notifies the observers.
        Parameters:
        variable - the value in which the complex number will be stored.
        value - the value to store into the variable.

      • sumToVariable

                          ComplexNumber cNumber)
                   throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Sums a complex number to a variable's value, then notifies the observers.
        Parameters:

        cNumber - the complex number to sum to a variable's value.
